creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app that gives you access to HMRC’s information on your personal tax affairs. Feel in control of your financial life by joining the 400,000 people who use the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government today.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

Registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and date of birth to get started.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay for the tax year 2019 to 2020. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.
descriptionShort: Personal tax, tax credits & Help to Save

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We have added in messages for people affected by Coronavirus (COVID-19). We have made some fixes to make the app more accessible for those using a screen reader. We have also fixed some bugs that were causing the app to crash.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay for the tax year 2019 to 2020. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.
descriptionShort: Personal tax, tax credits & Help to Save

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We have made improvements for the benefit of screen reader users. We would like people to choose to get emails instead of letters about tax. We have added a banner on the Pay As You Earn screen for people who have not opted in yet to tell them about this feature. We have fixed more bugs.

title: HMRC

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app that gives you access to HMRC’s information on your personal tax affairs. Feel in control of your financial life by joining the 400,000 people who use the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government today.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

Registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and date of birth to get started.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay for the tax year 2019 to 2020. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.
descriptionShort: Personal tax, tax credits & Help to Save

title: HMRC

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app that gives you access to HMRC’s information on your personal tax affairs. Feel in control of your financial life by joining the 400,000 people who use the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government today.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

Registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and date of birth to get started.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
We have made some changes to how you get around the app. Access codes can be found from the Settings screen, or from a link on Your Details. You can get to Settings by using the gear icon on all the main menu screens.

We have added information to make it easier for Help to Save account holders to set up payments from their bank account.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
You will now see your next or most recent payments from your job(s) on the PAYE screen.

We have improved how you can get proof of your National Insurance number from the app. The app now links to a copy of the letter from HMRC.

We have fixed an issue where some people were seeing the wrong name on the Money screen.

- find your tax code
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

Registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and date of birth to get started.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

The HMRC tax calculator tells you how much National Insurance and Income Tax you need to pay. You can use it to work out your take-home pay if you change your working hours, the amount you earn changes or you get a new job.

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.

Accessibility Statement
descriptionShort: Personal tax, tax credits & Help to Save

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
The app’s self assessment feature is now available in Welsh. You can enable Welsh language options from the settings screen.

title: HMRC

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app that gives you access to HMRC’s information on your personal tax affairs. Feel in control of your financial life by joining the 400,000 people who use the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government today.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check how much you owe on your Self Assessment and make a payment
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

Registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and date of birth to get started.

Depending on what your phone supports, you can use your face, fingerprint or iris to sign in quickly and securely.

Understanding tax

In the HMRC app you can see details about your job and salary and how your Income Tax, tax-free amount and take-home pay are calculated. If you have any income from a private pension then you can also see this.

You can also see your National Insurance number, Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) and tax code.

Keep track of your tax credits

You can check when tax credits have been paid and when your next tax credits payment is due. You can also renew your tax credits.

Tax calculator

Help to Save

Help to Save is a government savings account for people claiming tax credits and some other benefits. It gives you a bonus of 50p for every £1 you save. Find out if you are eligible for Help to Save in the app.

In the app you can track your savings and see how much your bonus is. You can set up savings reminders so that you remember to save each month.

Form tracker

Form tracker lets you find out when you can expect a response to forms you have sent to HMRC.

Accessibility Statement
descriptionShort: Personal tax, tax credits & Help to Save

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: You can now set Self Assessment payment and filing reminders. We’ve updated the take home pay calculator to include the National Insurance Primary Thresholds for July. And we’ve fixed an issue with Help to Save which was sending too many repeat notifications.

title: HMRC

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app for managing your personal tax from HMRC. Take control of your finances and join over 700,000 people using the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government now.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check how much you owe on your Self Assessment and make a payment
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code(s)
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

You can use your Government Gateway account to sign in. If you don’t have one, registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and birth date to start.

Once you’re set up, you can sign in quickly and securely using your face, fingerprint or iris (depending on device support).

title: HMRC

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app to access your personal tax details with HMRC. Take control of your finances and join over 700,000 people using the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government here.

The Self Assessment payment deadline is 31 January. Use the HMRC app to make your payment easily. You can approve a payment to come straight from your bank account.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check how much you owe on your Self Assessment and make a payment
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code(s)
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

You can use your Government Gateway account to sign in. If you don’t have one, registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and birth date to start.

Once you’re set up, you can sign in quickly and securely using your face, fingerprint or iris (depending on device support).
descriptionShort: Manage your personal tax, benefits & savings with HMRC

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: You can now change your app PIN. We’ve also made it easier to get help with Self Assessment and fixed a few bugs.

creator: HMRC
descriptionHtml:
The only app to access your personal tax details with HMRC. Take control of your finances and join over 700,000 people using the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government here.

The Self Assessment payment deadline is 31 January. Use the HMRC app to make your payment easily. You can approve a payment to come straight from your bank account.

Use the HMRC app to:

- check your next salary payment from your employer
- check how much you owe on your Self Assessment and make a payment
- check your next tax credit payments
- find your tax code(s)
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
- check progress on forms you have sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC

You can use your Government Gateway account to sign in. If you don’t have one, registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and birth date to start.

Once you’re set up, you can sign in quickly and securely using your face, fingerprint or iris (depending on device support).
descriptionShort: Manage your personal tax, benefits & savings with HMRC

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We've updated the take-home pay calculator with Income Tax and National Insurance rates for the 2023 to 2024 tax year.

title: HMRC

creator: HM Revenue & Customs
descriptionHtml:
The only app to access your personal tax details with HMRC. Take control of your finances and join over 1.1 million people using the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app here.

The HMRC app is a handy way to:

-check your pay a few days before pay day
-check previous payments from your employer
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
-check your company benefits
- find your tax codes
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
-work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator
- check how much Self Assessment tax you owe and make a payment
- set reminders for your Self Assessment payments
- check and save your Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) for Self Assessment
- check and save your National Insurance number
-check your next tax credit payments
- manage and renew your tax credits
- access your Help to Save account
- check your Child Benefit
- check your State Pension
- check progress on forms you’ve sent to HMRC
- read messages from HMRC
- update your postal address
- choose to be contacted by HMRC electronically, instead of by letter

You can use your Government Gateway account to sign in. If you don’t have one, registration is easy and fast. You will need your National Insurance number and birth date to start.

Once you’re set-up, you can sign in quickly and securely using your face, fingerprint or iris (depending on device support).
descriptionShort: Manage your personal tax, benefits & savings with HMRC

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: You can now rate the services in the app and use HMRC’s digital assistant to get help with queries. If you live in Wales, it’s now easier to switch the app to Welsh. We’ve also translated more of the app into Welsh.

title:
HMRC
15.8.0

creator: HM Revenue & Customs
descriptionHtml:
The only app to access your personal tax details with HMRC. Take control of your finances and join over 1.1 million people using the HMRC app every month. Download the HMRC app from the UK Government here.

Use this app to get help with Self Assessment and make payment by 31 January 2024. View your Unique Taxpayer Reference and income history to help prepare your tax return.

The HMRC app is also a handy way to:

-check your pay a few days before pay day
-check previous payments from your employer
- find out how much Income Tax you should pay
-check your company benefits
- find your tax codes
- claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax
-work out your take-home pay with the tax calculator

title:
HMRC
17.1.0

creator: HM Revenue & Customs
descriptionHtml:
Take control of your money and tax with the HMRC app

It’s secure, free to download, and easy to use. Get on it, and join millions of people already saving time with the HMRC app.

Key Features:

• Quick setup: sign in using face recognition, fingerprint scan, or a six-digit PIN
• Stay in control: check your tax code and see your pay before it even shows in your bank, so you know you're paying the right amount
• Claim a tax refund: find out if you’re due any tax back from us and quickly claim a refund if you’re owed one
• Check your State Pension: see how much State Pension you could get, when you can get it and how to increase it, if you can
• Self-Assessment: a safe and secure way to make Self-Assessment payments and get information you'll need to file
• Child Benefit support: claim, manage, and update your Child Benefit details
• National Insurance: find and save your National Insurance number so you have it when you need it
• Go paperless: opt to receive key messages from HMRC online

Download the HMRC app today and stay on top of your money and taxes
descriptionShort: Manage your personal tax, benefits & savings with HMRC

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: This latest update includes a number of bug fixes alongside minor improvements to the app.

- Stay in control: check your tax code and see your pay before it even shows in your bank, so you know you're paying the right amount
- Claim a tax refund: find out if you’re due any tax back from us and quickly claim a refund if you’re owed one
- Check your State Pension: see how much State Pension you could get, when you can get it and how to increase it, if you can
- Self Assessment: a safe and secure way to make Self Assessment payments and get information you'll need to file
- Child Benefit support: claim, manage, and update your Child Benefit details
- National Insurance: find and save your National Insurance number so you have it when you need it
- Go paperless: opt to receive key messages from HMRC online

Download the HMRC app today and stay on top of your money and taxes
descriptionShort: Manage your personal tax, benefits & savings with HMRC
